data.title: Great CA Burritos
data.text: This place has very generous lean portions of carne asada in their burritos. A nice spot for lunch and conveniently located.

data.title: Robertos! Taco shop...
data.text: This Robertos! Taco shop is right off of the freeway and on the way to a friend of mines Home. It was perfect way back in the Days of the near by Black Angus Square cow Club for that late night munchies run! The Salsa and Guacamole is by far better than all of the other so called "Bertos" joints.

data.title: Easy Access
data.text: The food is okay.  Nothing special.  But it is so easy to jump off the freeway grab a burrito and be on your way it is hard to pass up.  The carne asada is what you would expect but maybe a little salty.  I really don't think their nachos are very good though.

data.title: Good asada friea
data.text: Robertos is pretty good. It is a lot like Alberto's or other Mexican chain food. I would say the food is a bit more fresh here though. Very tasty if your in the mood for Mexican fast food

data.title: Tried it at last.
data.text: It took us a while to try out Roberto's Tacos and glad we did not have to rush. The chorizo combo may not have enough chorizos compared to my usual place in San Clemente. The surf and turf burrito was pretty big, could have it for 2 meals, and had a lot of flavor. Horchata was refillable but was too sweet. Definitely better food than DT or TB.

data.title: Inexpensive Mexican Food
data.text: You get what you pay for.  My sister and I had lunch at Roberto's Taco Shop today.  The menu offered a wide varity of Mexican entrees.  Most people were buying their burritos.  However, my sister and I decided on the chicken enchiladas plate.  Each entree came with two chicken enchiladas. The chicken enchiladas were lukewarm.  The chicken enchiladas were filled with shredded chicken, onions, bell peppers, covered in red sauce and topped with lettuce and cheese.  My sister and I felt the enchiladas were a little bland.  The prices were reasonable - $5.50 per entree.  I am not sure if I will return to Ricardo's.  If I do, I will definitely try something different.

data.title: Great Fast Mexican Food.
data.text: The Nachos with Chicken or Carne Asada are the best. The Burritos are huge and delicious! The staff are very nice and you will always want to return. We like gourmet meals but still find Roberto's to be a great stop on Sunday afternoons.
